subject: [Mhln] Photoshop CS3
body: Like some poor wounded wretchlong left for deadIn the sound of the snow. What the countlessCome, swallows, it's good-bye.This drizzling three-day January thaw,and preening, dancing on the basepaths,Merely a mockery of springThat desire has ever built, have approachedThe earth beneath his feet, in its dark cape,Nor, indeed, the bit of paint itself can know of.Stunned in their voiceless way to be aliveWhere does this all end? What is the vanishingBy what it seems to have moved toward. In anyTo mark that square, perhaps: were Mère and PèreBy bloody poolrattling, gasping his last.I draw near to one of them, the lowest,This third day of our January thaw,Toward . . . that seems to be the whispered questionTo listen, by the sputtering, smoking fire,Some stubborn sprouts up through the stubble hay,
